channel.title: book reviews on Jake Notes
channel.description: Recent content in book reviews on Jake Notes

item.title: Book Review: Metropolis
item.description: Metropolis by Philip Kerr 5/5 It is with such a heavy heart that I finished Metropolis. I found Philip Kerr via the trilogy ‘Berlin Noir’, a long time ago, I am not sure when exactly but I think it was around 1997. I have since read every book in the Bernie Gunther series and I have loved every one. I have read all the works by a number of authors but this series is about my favorite.

item.title: Book Review: Killing Commendatore
item.description: Killing Commendatore by Murakami Haruki 4/5 I think I have read every book by Murakami. I started when I was in my mid-20s, about 20 years ago, before I moved to Tokyo and before I knew anything about Japan. I read the books in chronological order and I can not say I have liked them all. In any book, when a character dreams, or when the story departs into magic realism, I tend to zone out.
